# Chancellor Family

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Jump to navigation Jump to search

Chancellor family  
---  
 _[The Young and the Restless](/wiki/The_Young_and_the_Restless "The Young and
the Restless")_ family  
Created by|  [William J. Bell](/wiki/William_J._Bell "William J. Bell")  
Introduced by|  [John Conboy](/wiki/John_Conboy "John Conboy")  
Duration|  1973—  
First appearance|  November 1973  
  
The **Chancellors** are [fictional characters](/wiki/Fictional_characters
"Fictional characters") and a core family from the [CBS
Daytime](/wiki/CBS_Daytime "CBS Daytime") [soap opera](/wiki/Soap_opera "Soap
opera"), _[The Young and the Restless](/wiki/The_Young_and_the_Restless "The
Young and the Restless")_.

Since their introduction in 1973, the family has mainly been represented by
[Katherine Chancellor](/wiki/Katherine_Chancellor "Katherine Chancellor")
([Jeanne Cooper](/wiki/Jeanne_Cooper "Jeanne Cooper")) and her feud with her
husband [Phillip II](/wiki/Phillip_Chancellor_II "Phillip Chancellor II")
([Donnelly Rhodes](/wiki/Donnelly_Rhodes "Donnelly Rhodes"))'s young mistress
[Jill Foster](/wiki/Jill_Foster_Abbott "Jill Foster Abbott") ([Jess
Walton](/wiki/Jess_Walton "Jess Walton")). After years of feuding, Jill and
Katherine form a bond and Kay becomes a mother figure to Jill, and a
grandmother to Jill's sons. The family is currently represented by Jill, her
son [Billy Abbott](/wiki/Billy_Abbott "Billy Abbott") ([Jason
Thompson](/wiki/Jason_Thompson_\(actor\) "Jason Thompson \(actor\)")), and his
children and Katherine's own grandchildren [Devon
Hamilton](/wiki/Devon_Hamilton "Devon Hamilton") ([Bryton
James](/wiki/Bryton_James "Bryton James")) and [Mackenzie
Browning](/wiki/Mackenzie_Browning "Mackenzie Browning") ([Kelly
Kruger](/wiki/Kelly_Kruger "Kelly Kruger")).

## Family
members[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Chancellor_Family&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Family members")]

### First
Generation[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Chancellor_Family&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: First Generation")]

The history of the Chancellor family is deeply rooted in the history of Genoa
City, which was founded by Civil War hero Garfield Dandridge Chancellor. In
1973 Garfield’s great-great-grandson, Phillip Chancellor II, was running
Chancellor Industries. He resided in the Chancellor mansion with his alcoholic
and promiscuous wife Katherine (Kay). The two barely communicated with each
other as husband and wife, and the lonely Phillip, driven to distraction by
Katherine’s obsessive behavior, sought refuge in the company of Katherine’s
young and beautiful paid companion, Jill Foster. [1] Phillip and Jill fell in
love, Jill was a virgin but became pregnant the one and only time they made
love. Phillip obtained a divorce from Katherine in the Dominican Republic, but
Katherine got her revenge by picking Phillip up from the airport on his
return, and drove him off a cliff when he refused to give her another chance.
Phillip married Jill on his deathbed in order to provide for her and their
unborn child. However, Katherine later had Phillip's divorce from her
invalidated, on the basis she was drunk when she signed the divorce papers,
which automatically annulled Phillip and Jill's marriage. So Katherine was
reinstated as Phillip's legal widow. Phillip's affair with Jill Foster
produced a son, Phillip III. The stage was set for a long and bitter feud
between the two women that would continue for decades.

  *     * _[Katherine Chancellor](/wiki/Katherine_Chancellor "Katherine Chancellor")_ ([Jeanne Cooper](/wiki/Jeanne_Cooper "Jeanne Cooper"))   
Born on October 25, 1928 as Katherine Shepherd, and known affectionately as
Kay, Katherine marries high school and college sweetheart Gary Reynolds.
Together they have one son, Brock. When Brock and Gary are out of the country,
Katherine has an affair with Gary's golfing buddy, [Arthur
Hendricks](/wiki/The_Young_and_the_Restless_characters_\(2000s\)#Arthur_Hendricks
"The Young and the Restless characters \(2000s\)") and later gives birth to
his son, Tucker, who she secretly gave up for adoption without even seeing
him. After Gary's passing, Katherine marries Phillip Chancellor. However,
Katherine and Phillip's unhappy marriage is upended by Jill Foster who gets
pregnant with his child. The two women would fight over everything from men to
children for the next four decades. Katherine was remarried in 2009 to Patrick
Murphy.[2] Katherine dies on August 1, 2013 at the age of 84.[3]

### Second
Generation[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Chancellor_Family&action=edit&section=3
"Edit section: Second Generation")]

  * [Brock Reynolds](/wiki/The_Young_and_the_Restless_characters_\(1970s\)#Brock_Reynolds "The Young and the Restless characters \(1970s\)") ([Beau Kazer](/wiki/Beau_Kazer "Beau Kazer"))   
Brock is Katherine's son with her first husband, Gary Reynolds. When Brock is
first introduced as a rebellious college aged kid, wasting his inheritance in
[Europe](/wiki/Europe "Europe"), with childhood friend, [Lorie
Brooks](/wiki/Lorie_Brooks "Lorie Brooks"). After Gary's passing and
Katherine's remarriage, Brock's rebellion started with wild sex and drugs.
Brock comes in and out of his mother's life over the years. In 1974, Brock
returned home a changed man and a minister. He also has a brief marriage to
Jill Foster. Brock obtains a law degree while living in [Paris](/wiki/Paris
"Paris"). Brock has one child with former lover, [Amanda
Browning](/wiki/The_Young_and_the_Restless_characters_\(2000s\)#Amanda_Browning
"The Young and the Restless characters \(2000s\)"), Mackenzie who comes to
Genoa City in 1999. Brock currently resides in [New Orleans](/wiki/New_Orleans
"New Orleans") where he volunteers rebuilding homes for the victims of
[Hurricane Katrina](/wiki/Hurricane_Katrina "Hurricane Katrina"). He is the
chairman of the _Chancellor Foundation_ , and also a singer.[4]

  * [Tucker McCall](/wiki/Tucker_McCall "Tucker McCall") ([Stephen Nichols](/wiki/Stephen_Nichols "Stephen Nichols"))   
Tucker is Katherine's illegitimate son with Judge [Arthur
Hendricks](/wiki/The_Young_and_the_Restless_characters_\(2000s\)#Arthur_Hendricks
"The Young and the Restless characters \(2000s\)") given away at birth by a
drunken Katherine. Former rock and roll manager, Tucker comes to Genoa City in
2009 and steals the company out from under his mother. Tucker immediately
clashes with wealthy businessman and Katherine's close friend, [Victor
Newman](/wiki/Victor_Newman "Victor Newman"). He marries [Ashley
Abbott](/wiki/Ashley_Abbott "Ashley Abbott"), and after a brief coma is
reunited with his illegitimate son, Devon, with former music groupie, [Yolanda
Hamilton](/wiki/Yolanda_Hamilton "Yolanda Hamilton"). Devon and Tucker's
relationship starts off rocky, but they eventually start to bond. Tucker also
has a relationship with Jill and helps her find her biological family. Tucker
and Katherine's relationship has many ups and downs, but they eventually
reconcile before he relocates to [Hong Kong](/wiki/Hong_Kong "Hong Kong") in
2013. Tucker was with Katherine and Murphy when his mother passed.[5]

  * [Phillip Chancellor III](/wiki/The_Young_and_the_Restless_characters_\(1970s\)#Phillip_Chancellor_III "The Young and the Restless characters \(1970s\)") ([Thom Bierdz](/wiki/Thom_Bierdz "Thom Bierdz"))   
Born on December 25, 1975, Phillip III is Phillip II's son with Jill Foster.
Despite the feud between Jill and Katherine, Phillip bonds with both women.
Phillip spends majority of his life in boarding schools. In 1986, the 16-year-
old Phillip returns home when his mother gets shot. Katherine and Jill battle
for his affections. Meanwhile, Phillip falls for [Cricket
Blair](/wiki/Christine_Blair "Christine Blair"), but is seduced by the
scheming [Nina Webster](/wiki/Nina_Webster "Nina Webster") and father's her
son, Phillip IV. Phillip and Nina marry in 1989 and he dies from injuries
sustained in a car accident a month later.[6][7] However, in 2009, Phillip
reveals that he faked his death to escape the pressure of living up to the
Chancellor name. He also admits to being gay. Phillip currently lives in
[Australia](/wiki/Australia "Australia").[8]

### Third
Generation[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Chancellor_Family&action=edit&section=4
"Edit section: Third Generation")]

  * [Mackenzie Browning Hellstrom](/wiki/Mackenzie_Browning "Mackenzie Browning") ([Kelly Kruger](/wiki/Kelly_Kruger "Kelly Kruger"))   
Born on December 30, 1983,[9] Mackenzie is first introduced as homeless
teenager staying at the Genoa City shelter where she meets Katherine. The
runaway was eventually revealed to be Brock's daughter with [Amanda
Browning](/wiki/The_Young_and_the_Restless_characters_\(2000s\)#Amanda_Browning
"The Young and the Restless characters \(2000s\)"). Mackenzie, known
affectionately as Mac falls for [Billy Abbott](/wiki/Billy_Abbott "Billy
Abbott"), and they marry but the marriage is quickly annulled when the two are
mistakenly led to believe they are cousins. Mac later falls for J.T.
Hellstrom, during his marriage and they conceive a child which Mackenzie
miscarries. Mackenzie stands in as the surrogate mother for
[Cane](/wiki/Cane_Ashby "Cane Ashby") and [Lily Ashby](/wiki/Lily_Winters
"Lily Winters")'s twins. Mackenzie is the former owner of _Crimson Lights_ ,
and _Jimmy 's Bar_. Mackenzie and J.T. marry in November 2010 when they learn
she is pregnant. The couple then relocates to [Washington, D.
C.](/wiki/Washington,_D._C. "Washington, D. C.") where they give birth to son,
Dylan "D.J." Hellstrom in 2011. When Katherine passes away, Mackenzie is
unable to attend the funeral.[10]

  * [Devon Hamilton](/wiki/Devon_Hamilton "Devon Hamilton") ([Bryton James](/wiki/Bryton_James "Bryton James"))   
Born on February 7, 1988,[11] Devon is first introduced as a troubled teenager
at the Genoa City Rec Center. [Lily Winters](/wiki/Lily_Winters "Lily
Winters") and billionaire [Victor Newman](/wiki/Victor_Newman "Victor Newman")
take a liking to Devon; Victor even considers adopting him. Instead, Devon is
adopted by [Neil](/wiki/Neil_Winters "Neil Winters") and
[Drucilla](/wiki/Drucilla_Winters "Drucilla Winters"), Lily's parents. Devon
has trouble adjusting to being in a stable family unit, but when he finally
does, Devon becomes very protective of his family. Between 2006 and 2007,
Devon contracts [meningitis](/wiki/Meningitis "Meningitis") and loses his
hearing completely. He later gets a cochlear implant surgery. From 2007 to
2013, Devon has an enduring romance with
[Roxanne](/wiki/The_Young_and_the_Restless_characters_\(2000s\)#Roxanne "The
Young and the Restless characters \(2000s\)"). In 2011, Devon is discovered to
be Katherine and Judge Arthur Hendrick's grandson, and Tucker is his
biological father. Though he initially wants nothing to do with Katherine and
Tucker, the group eventually work through their differences and form
relationships. He also reconnects with his estranged biological mother,
[Yolanda](/wiki/The_Young_and_the_Restless_characters_\(2011\)#Yolanda_Hamilton
"The Young and the Restless characters \(2011\)"). Upon Katherine's passing,
Devon inherits half of her estate. From 2013 to 2014, Devon falls in love with
[Hilary Curtis](/wiki/Hilary_Curtis "Hilary Curtis") ([Mishael
Morgan](/wiki/Mishael_Morgan "Mishael Morgan")), and they start an affair
despite her marriage to Neil. They married in August 2015[12] and divorce in
April 2017.

  * [Phillip "Chance" Chancellor IV](/wiki/Chance_Chancellor "Chance Chancellor") ([John Driscoll](/wiki/John_Driscoll_\(actor\) "John Driscoll \(actor\)"))   
Born on March 15, 1988,[13][14] Phillip Chancellor IV is the son of Phillip
III and Nina Webster. In 2009, Phillip returns to Genoa City all grown up and
reunites with his father first time since his presumed dead in 1989. Now known
as Chance, Phillip IV struggles to accept his father while he falls for [Chloe
Abbott](/wiki/Chloe_Mitchell "Chloe Mitchell"). Chance and Chloe become
engaged but the relationship eventually ends. However, he later loses his
virginity to Chloe. Chance also becomes involved with [Heather
Stevens](/wiki/Heather_Stevens "Heather Stevens"). In 2010, Chance meets his
half-brother, FBI Agent [Ronan Malloy](/wiki/Ronan_Malloy "Ronan Malloy") for
the first time. In late 2010, Chance fakes his death with Ronan's help in
order to bring down a crime ring. After revealing himself, Chance leaves town
to start military intelligence training at [The Pentagon](/wiki/The_Pentagon
"The Pentagon").[15]

### Fourth
Generation[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Chancellor_Family&action=edit&section=5
"Edit section: Fourth Generation")]

  * Dylan "D.J." Hellstrom   
Born on June 21, 2011 in [Washington, D.C.](/wiki/Washington,_D.C.
"Washington, D.C."), Dylan is the son of J.T. and Mackenzie Hellstrom.
Mackenzie learns she is pregnant in late 2010. She and J.T. marry and later
leave town.[10][16][17]

  * Becca Hellstrom   
Becca is the daughter of J.T. and Mackenzie Hellstrom.[18][19]

**Chancellor Industries** (**CI**) was a major design-and-engineering
conglomerate, headquartered in [Genoa City,
Wisconsin](/wiki/Genoa_City_\(fictional_city\) "Genoa City \(fictional
city\)").

Before his death, Phillip Chancellor II supervised all of the company's
holdings, including the factory in Genoa City where Liz Foster worked. After
Phillip's death, Katherine relied on good friend [Victor
Newman](/wiki/Victor_Newman "Victor Newman") to keep an eye on things, and on
Mitchell Sherman for legal advice. [20] In later years Jill Foster Abbott,
[Neil Winters](/wiki/Neil_Winters "Neil Winters"), and Cane Ashby all acted as
CEO. For a brief period Katherine hired [Jack
Abbott](/wiki/Jack_Abbott_\(The_Young_and_the_Restless\) "Jack Abbott \(The
Young and the Restless\)") as CEO. It was also the parent company of Jabot
Cosmetics.

The company was referred to as a sleeping giant according to former CEO [Jack
Abbott](/wiki/Jack_Abbott_\(The_Young_and_the_Restless\) "Jack Abbott \(The
Young and the Restless\)"), CI was "financially capable and always without
scandal."

For a couple years CI was wholly owned subsidiary of [Tucker McCall
Unlimited](/wiki/Tucker_McCall "Tucker McCall") when Katherine's long lost
son, billionaire business mogul [Tucker McCall](/wiki/Tucker_McCall "Tucker
McCall") assumed ownership via a hostile takeover. Tucker eventually sold
Katherine majority ownership of CI under pressure from [Victor
Newman](/wiki/Victor_Newman "Victor Newman").

A couple of weeks after Katherine's funeral, on September 27, 2013, Victor
Newman received a letter from Katherine leaving him Chancellor Industries. Her
letter to him read: _My Dear friend Victor, by the time you read this, you
will have learned of my passing. I lived a long and colorful life and have no
regrets about entering the next phase of my journey, save one. I wanted to
ensure the longevity of my beloved Chancellor Industries. That is why I 've
decided to name you the sole owner of the company. I hope you will accept this
gift in the loving spirit in which it was given. Love, Katherine._ As the new
majority shareholder and Chairman of Chancellor Industries, Victor immediately
plans a merger between Chancellor and [Newman
Enterprises](/wiki/Newman_Enterprises "Newman Enterprises"). The new company
is titled Newman-Chancellor Industries.

Victor was having cash management issues due to some bad acquisitions, so it
became necessary for him to sell Chancellor Industries. He gave Jill an
exclusive opportunity before putting it on the market, acknowledging

    
    
    _" If Katherine would want the company to go to anyone but me, I think it would be Jill."_ [21] On February 2, 2015 Jill Foster Abbott bought Chancellor Industries from Victor Newman.
    

Currently Jill Foster Abbott Atkinson is the sole owner of Chancellor
Industries. Cane Ashby is its CEO. Katherine's grandson [Devon
Hamilton](/wiki/Devon_Hamilton "Devon Hamilton") loaned Jill some of the money
for the purchase initially because of a blackmail attempt by Jill's husband,
and Cane's father [Colin
Atkinson](/wiki/The_Young_and_the_Restless_characters_\(2010\)#Colin_Atkinson
"The Young and the Restless characters \(2010\)"). But later Devon gave the
money of his own free will explaining _" You know, Jill, Katherine gave me
this money to do what I want with it, and what I want is for you and Cane to
have the company. I really do. As long as Colin has nothing to do with
it._[22]
